function: Provide navigation between different game pages to access various functionalities.
static_description: A navigation bar displayed across the top or side of the screen with links to Base, Ranking, Store, Train, Workers, Upgrades, Bank, Messages, and Reports pages.

interaction_and_states.description: Navigates the user to the selected page route upon clicking the corresponding link.

resource_dependency.raceDataSchema: Table 'races' with columns: id (UUID), name (string), description (text), bonus_attributes (JSONB).

function: Allow players to choose a race with unique attributes before starting gameplay.
static_description: A full-screen modal or dedicated page with a seashell background displaying four distinct race cards (Humans, Dragonborns, Elves, Dwarfs) each with a brief description and associated bonuses.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a race confirms the choice and initializes the player profile with that raceâ€™s attributes.

resource_dependency.resourcesDataSchema: Table 'player_resources' with columns: player_id (UUID), gold (integer), iron (integer), wood (integer), wheat (integer).

function: Display current quantities of essential resources for active gameplay decisions.
static_description: A persistent header element showing icons and numeric values for Gold, Iron, Wood, and Wheat aligned horizontally near the top of the screen.

resource_dependency.upgradeListDataSchema: Table 'city_upgrades' with columns: id (UUID), name (string), cost_gold (integer), cost_iron (integer), cost_wood (integer), cost_wheat (integer), effect_description (text), level_required (integer).

function: Enable players to improve their base infrastructure through upgrades.
static_description: A grid layout presenting available city upgrades with names, costs in resources, required levels, and effects.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking an upgrade initiates purchase validation against player resources and applies the upgrade if successful.

resource_dependency.workerTypesDataSchema: Table 'worker_types' with columns: id (UUID), name (string), description (text), production_rate (JSONB), cost_gold (integer), cost_iron (integer), cost_wood (integer), cost_wheat (integer).
resource_dependency.assignedWorkersDataSchema: Table 'assigned_workers' with columns: player_id (UUID), worker_type_id (UUID), quantity (integer).

function: Allow players to assign and upgrade workers responsible for resource generation.
static_description: A dual-panel view: left panel lists worker types with stats and costs; right panel shows currently assigned workers per type.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking '+' or '-' buttons adjusts the number of assigned workers of a specific type after verifying sufficient resources.

resource_dependency.soldierTypesDataSchema: Table 'soldier_types' with columns: id (UUID), name (string), attack_power (integer), defense_power (integer), recruitment_cost_gold (integer), recruitment_cost_iron (integer), upgrade_cost_gold (integer), upgrade_cost_iron (integer).
resource_dependency.trainedSoldiersDataSchema: Table 'trained_soldiers' with columns: player_id (UUID), soldier_type_id (UUID), quantity (integer), level (integer).

function: Facilitate recruitment and upgrading of soldiers for military engagement.
static_description: Tabbed interface listing soldier types with recruitment/upgrade costs, attack/defense stats, and current trained counts.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Recruit' or 'Upgrade' validates resources and updates the trained soldiers table accordingly.

resource_dependency.storeItemsDataSchema: Table 'store_items' with columns: id (UUID), name (string), category (enum: resource, item, upgrade), price_gold (integer), effect_description (text), availability_condition (text).

function: Offer a marketplace for buying resources, items, or upgrades using gold.
static_description: Categorized listings of purchasable goods with icons, prices, descriptions, and buy buttons arranged in a responsive grid.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Buy' deducts gold from the player's balance and adds the purchased item or resource amount to their inventory.

resource_dependency.bankAccountDataSchema: Table 'bank_accounts' with columns: player_id (UUID), stored_gold (integer), interest_rate (decimal), last_interest_claimed_at (timestamp).

function: Support secure long-term storage of gold with interest accumulation over time.
static_description: Dashboard-style panel showing total stored gold, current interest rate, time until next interest gain, and action buttons for depositing, withdrawing, and claiming interest.

interaction_and_states.description: 'Deposit', 'Withdraw', and 'Claim Interest' buttons trigger respective transactions validated server-side.

resource_dependency.messageThreadDataSchema: Table 'messages' with columns: id (UUID), sender_id (UUID), recipient_id (UUID), subject (string), content (text), sent_at (timestamp), read_status (boolean).

function: Enable communication between players via private messaging.
static_description: Inbox view displaying message threads with sender names, subjects, timestamps, and unread indicators. Message detail view shows conversation history.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a thread opens the detailed message exchange. Clicking 'Send' submits a new reply or message.

resource_dependency.combatSimulationEngine: External service simulating turn-based battles based on unit stats and strategies.
resource_dependency.battleResultDataSchema: Table 'battles' with columns: id (UUID), attacker_id (UUID), defender_id (UUID), outcome (enum: win, loss, draw), rewards (JSONB), timestamp (timestamp).

function: Allow players to initiate and resolve combat encounters with other players.
static_description: Battle initiation screen with opponent selection and army composition preview. Results screen displays outcome summary, casualties, and rewards earned.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Attack' queues a match request. Upon resolution, redirects to results screen showing battle outcome and applying changes.

resource_dependency.leaderboardDataSchema: Table 'player_scores' with columns: player_id (UUID), username (string), score (integer), rank (integer), last_updated (timestamp).

function: Showcase competitive standings among all players based on accumulated scores.
static_description: Leaderboard table listing top-ranked players with usernames, scores, and ranks, styled with alternating row colors and highlighted personal position.

resource_dependency.activityLogDataSchema: Table 'activity_logs' with columns: id (UUID), player_id (UUID), event_type (string), description (text), related_entity_id (UUID), timestamp (timestamp).

function: Present historical records of player actions, especially battles and significant achievements.
static_description: Chronological feed of past events grouped by date, with expandable entries providing detailed context about each logged activity.

interaction_and_states.description: Expanding an entry reveals extended details such as involved entities, exact resource changes, or battle summaries.

resource_dependency.gameAPISpecification: RESTful endpoints serving dynamic data including player profiles, resources, rankings, messages, etc., secured with JWT authentication.
resource_dependency.databaseConnectionConfig: Environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.

function: Serve all dynamic game data securely to the frontend via well-defined REST APIs.
static_description: Backend layer exposing structured API routes mapped to database queries and business logic handlers without direct user-facing visuals.

function: Establish reliable connectivity to PostgreSQL database instance for persistent game state storage.
static_description: Configuration file specifying database connection parameters sourced from predefined environment variables ensuring secure access.

resource_dependency.installScriptCommand: concurrently "cd frontend && npm install" "cd backend && npm install"
resource_dependency.devScriptCommand: concurrently "cd frontend && npm run dev" "cd backend && npm run dev"

function: Streamline development setup and execution by configuring unified installation and launch scripts.
static_description: Scripts defined under 'scripts' section in root-level package.json enabling one-command setup and concurrent frontend/backend startup.
